content.description: Nice zig-zag line of finger-to-hand cracks
content.location: After turning onto peninsula trail, go to bottom of short hill.  Turn left and head off-trail towards the water’s edge.  Make a right before you get to the water and it’s about 50’ ahead.

content.description: Use the detached section of the boulder below/right of the 3+ inch crack as your starting footholds, and use the crack as the starting undercling (see pic). Stand up, then get your hands onto nice crimps to your left. Step around with your feet onto the clean face of the boulder (more fun if you don't use the original detached rock as a foothold following the start). Go straight up, making sure not to use the Zigzag crack at all.... I'm not aware of any history of this route or if it's ever been done. If anyone has alternate FA information, please let me know.
content.location: 4 ft to the right of Zigzag

content.description: Follow the obvious wide crack.  Quick and easy.
content.location: After turning onto peninsula trail, go to bottom of short hill.  Turn left and head off-trail towards the water’s edge

content.description: Approximately 10’ tall, fun network of nice finger-to-hand size cracks.
content.location: After turning onto peninsula trail, go to bottom of short hill.  Turn left and head off-trail towards the water’s edge

pathTokens: Burr Pond State Park / Paugnut State Forest

content.description: Several nice boulders, approximately 8-12’ tall on and just off of the “peninsula trail”.
